ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: As an historian who works on the early modern Sephardic diaspora, I now have a much better grasp of 16th century Italian literature. This knowledge is an invaluable component in understanding the types of sources that were available for mass consumption among the historical actors at the center of my research.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I have not experienced another course like Professor Stephens' in my three semesters at Yale. His enthusiasm for our course readings and the subject matter of our discussions is unparalleled, that is to say I have not studied with another professor who is so engaged and engaging during class. His level of dedication made this course exceptional compared to others I have taken at Yale.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to other students, especially fellow historians. Listening to Stephens' weekly discussions of our readings was invaluable given my preexisting interest in this period.
